channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Remembering Michele Singer Reiner: Photographer, film producer and activist
item.description: The photographer, film producer and activist was killed alongside her husband, director and actor Rob Reiner on Sunday.
item.content:encoded: The photographer, film producer and activist was killed alongside her husband, director and actor Rob Reiner on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Chinese man who secretly filmed detention camps in China faces deportation from U.S.
item.description: A Chinese man who filmed alleged detention camps in China faces possible deportation to Uganda under the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded: A Chinese man who filmed alleged detention camps in China faces possible deportation to Uganda under the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: The U.S. birth rate is on the decline. But not for women 40 and older
item.description: Although the U.S. birth rate is on the decline, the number of women having babies in one age group has increased. Those new mothers are 40 and older.
item.content:encoded: Although the U.S. birth rate is on the decline, the number of women having babies in one age group has increased. Those new mothers are 40 and older.
item.dc:creator: Bek Shackelford

item.title: EU leaders decide on whether to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's war effort
item.description: European Union leaders meet in Brussels on Thursday to decide on using frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's war effort.
item.content:encoded: European Union leaders meet in Brussels on Thursday to decide on using frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's war effort.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Venezuela's government says Trump's move to block tankers is an 'outrageous threat'
item.description: President Trump says he's imposing a ban on all sanctioned oil tankers leaving Venezuela. Venezuela's government is calling this an 'outrageous threat' intended to rob the country of its oil wealth.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says he's imposing a ban on all sanctioned oil tankers leaving Venezuela. Venezuela's government is calling this an 'outrageous threat' intended to rob the country of its oil wealth.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Nuns who broke out of their nursing home await word from Rome
item.description: NPR has been following the story of three octogenarian Austrian nuns who broke out of a nursing home and back into their old convent. Now, they're hoping for a deal with the Vatican so they can stay.
item.content:encoded: NPR has been following the story of three octogenarian Austrian nuns who broke out of a nursing home and back into their old convent. Now, they're hoping for a deal with the Vatican so they can stay.
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson

item.title: Providence mayor says team investigating Brown shooting is focused and working well
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Brett Smiley, mayor of Providence, R.I., about the investigation into the shooting at Brown University.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Brett Smiley, mayor of Providence, R.I., about the investigation into the shooting at Brown University.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Handel

item.title: A library helps foster an unlikely friendship
item.description: A devotion to reading brings one elderly woman in Indiana to her local library. That's true for one young child, too. They've formed an unlikely friendship and visit the library together each week.
item.content:encoded: A devotion to reading brings one elderly woman in Indiana to her local library. That's true for one young child, too. They've formed an unlikely friendship and visit the library together each week.
item.dc:creator: Ella Abbott

item.title: FCC chair is grilled by Senate Democrats
item.description: Democratic lawmakers confronted Federal Communications Commission Chairman Brendan Carr at a hearing Wednesday, arguing that he was attempting to intimidate reporters and networks.
item.content:encoded: Democratic lawmakers confronted Federal Communications Commission Chairman Brendan Carr at a hearing Wednesday, arguing that he was attempting to intimidate reporters and networks.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Gaza ceasefire: The next steps
item.description: The U.S. is pushing for the Gaza ceasefire to move into its next phase, but serious challenges lie ahead.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. is pushing for the Gaza ceasefire to move into its next phase, but serious challenges lie ahead.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
